Topic.Title: The iphone5 is just a small chapter in the AAPL story

Message.Msg: You are only partially correct. Yes the PE is low, but the sales to price and other ratios are really much higher and this is where the iphone comes in to play. The reason the PE is so low is because the gross margins are so high so that every dollar of sales means much more income. The gross margins are in the mid 40% range and this is obscene and probably unsustainable over the long term, but what is the long term and when will they change? With iphone margins running 70% the gross margins will drop as soon as the iphone sales plateau. That is what everyone is watching for. ipads, etc. are great and will be the future but the gross margins are around 37%, much lower than the 70% for the iphones. This change in product mix will change the relationship of price to sales ratio and PE ratios to a more normal balance. The question will be will the ipad sales grow fast enough so that this sales to PE adjustment occurs as a plateauing or slowing of the price rise rather than a price drop. I believe that ipad will be big enough to offset this gross margin drop off, but there could be a little volatility during the process. Might give us an excellent buying opportunity. We will see.

Message.Title: Charlotte hot air balloon
Message.Msg: A woman in a hot air balloon realized she was lost. She lowered her altitude and spotted a man in a boat below. She shouted to him, "Excuse me, can you help me? I promised a friend I would meet him an hour ago, but I don't know where I am." The man consulted his portable GPS and replied, "You're in a hot air balloon, approximately 30 feet above ground elevation of 2,346 feet above sea level. You are at 31 degrees, 14.97 minutes north latitude and 100 degrees, 49.09 minutes west longitude. She rolled her eyes and said, "You must be a Republican. "I am," replied the man. "How did you know?" "Well," answered the balloonist, "everything you told me is technically correct. But I have no idea what to do with your information, and I'm still lost. Frankly, you've not been much help to me." The man smiled and responded, "You must be an Obama-Democrat." "I am," replied the balloonist. "How did you know?" "Well," said the man, "you don't know where you are -- or where you are going. You've risen to where you are, due to a large quantity of hot air. You made a promise you have no idea how to keep, and you expect me to solve your problem. You're in exactly the same position you were in before we met, but somehow, now it's my fault."

Topic.Title: The iphone5 is just a small chapter in the AAPL story

Message.Msg: Very good point! This to me is one of the big questions concerning the future and is somewhat related to the "law" of large numbers in that in order to keep growing at such a fast pace at such a high level, the margins must be maintained (or compensated for with higher sales numbers, bigger market share or new products--the first two of these having limits somewhere). Who knows how long it will take to hit this "wall." I think AAPL is a safe bet for strong growth and numbers and higher pps for at least 9 months and a price of 830 (of course with ups and downs on the way)--probably more like 18 months and 950 (many people would multiply that time frame by 5 or 10 and price by 3). After that (9 mos.), I think take it a day at a time and procede with caution, continual reassessment. But in the same breath, I wouldn`t be shocked to see AAPL at 1000 a year from now, though I`m not counting on it. So much depends on how they do in China.

Topic.Title: The iphone5 is just a small chapter in the AAPL story

Message.Msg: What is seldom mentioned when talking about aapl's growth prospects is the fact they are selling products into two growing markets...smartphone and tablet. The smartphone market, for instance, is projected to triple in size by 2015, globally. Given how young the tablet market is, it's safe to assume this kind of market growth in this category as well. The relevance of these facts to aapl's margins and revenues is, as they experience greater competitive pressure on price, they will likely be in great position to make up for lower margins with increased unit sales in both iPhones and iPads because of the much larger market sizes for each, if necessary. Thus, growinf margin dollars while margin percentages compress. Then again, maybe they can maintain current margin percentages AND grow unit sales in the coming years. Now THAT would be NICE!!

Message.Title: Here’s how to check if your Apple device UDID has been compromised by the AntiSec leak
Message.Msg: Here’s how to check if your Apple device UDID has been compromised by the AntiSec leak. If you’re worried that you might own one of the 1 million Apple devices that have had their UDIDs leaked by AntiSec, reportedly from a breach of an FBI agent’s laptop, our rockstar tech team has put together a tool to help you check. AntiSec claimed on Tuesday that it had culled 12 million device IDs, along with accompanying personal information, from the FBI in March of this year. The hacker group then leaked 1 million of them, saying it had removed some of the identifiable information from the list, while leaving enough for users to see if their device was leaked. To check your device, just input your UDID/UUID into the form and we’ll run it against the database. If you need help finding the code, you can head here for a tutorial. Of course, TNW won’t store your identifier. Since UDIDs are unique to each iPhone and iPad, having yours end up in the wrong hands is a concern. The bigger issue, however, is that they were tied to additional personal information, including user names, device names, notification tokens, cell phone numbers and addresses, that could potentially lead to identity theft.

Message.Title: Why iOS is superior to Android
Message.Msg: Information Weeks "iPads vs Androids: 2012 Tablet Buyer's Guide" When Apple releases a new iOS version, it’s immediately available for every device in the iOS line, from a 2-year-old iPod Touch to the latest iPhone 4S. In contrast, because each vendor must port Android to its specific hardware, there’s often a considerable lag between Google releasing an update and a version being available for a particular device. To wit, even though Google released Ice Cream Sandwich in October and has updated it three times since, all the tablets in our roundup still ship with older 3.x software, and only Motorola and Sony make any commitment to ever update their products. Thus, even IT organizations that prefer Android’s openness, customizability and feature set may be wary of the potential nightmare of simultaneously having to support several versions a situation that won’t necessarily be mitigated by standardizing on a particular vendor, because newer products will ship with OS versions that may never get ported to older hardware.

Topic.Title: 20M plus Apple IDs compromised

Message.Msg: Nice try idiot shorty! This is a non issue. "Instead of joining the FBI, as special agent Christopher Stangl urged them to do in a recruitment video three years ago, computer scientists associated with the hacker networks Anonymous and Antisec hacked into his laptop, and stole a database of Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) device ID numbers. Some of the 12.4 million IDs, called unique device identifier numbers (UDID), came with user names, the name of the device, the device type, zipcodes, cell phone numbers and addresses, the hackers said in a blog post, in which they announced the publication of 1 million of the UDID numbers. In the post, the author derides FBI attempts to recruit hackers, writing, "We decided we'd help out Internet security by auditing FBI first." The point of the effort appears to be not only to embarrass the FBI. The hackers say their exploit proves the FBI is using device data for some kind of a "tracking people project." Forbes contacted Stangl, who did not wish to comment. The FBI and Apple have not yet issued statements. Anonymous and Antisec have said they won't comment further." Anonymous are the good guys "hackers".

Message.Title: Release of the Apple I Phone's and its Relationship to Stock Price!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Message.Msg: As shares of Apple (AAPL) stock hit all-time highs ahead of the company’s next-generation iPhone launch, Apple recently became the most valuable company in history when not accounting for inflation. The “iPhone 5” is set to finally become a reality next week, and just about every Apple analyst on the planet is saying it will be Apple’s biggest launch ever. But how might the unveiling of the next iPhone impact Apple’s stock? Germany-based statistics company Statista put together a series of charts for Mashable outlining exactly how shares of Apple have performed in the days leading up to and following recent high-profile product launches, and the data is intriguing. This is by no means a clear-cut guide on how to play Apple’s iPhone unveiling next week, of course, but there may indeed be some trends worth investigating. The firm’s full infographic follows below. Topic.Title: THE MOST OVERPRICED SCAM AROUND THE WORLD

Message.Msg: Republican Vice-presidential candidate Paul Ryan made a claim in a radio show last week that he once ran a marathon in "under three, high two. I had a two hour 50 something." "Runner's World" magazine decided to check out the claim and scoured through the times of the Grandma's Marathon in Duluth, Minn., the only marathon the candidate has run, back when he was 20. Results show that Ryan's actual time was four hours, one minute 25 seconds. Had his original statement been true, Ryan would have been the fastest marathoner ever to run for the White House. But Sarah Palin, GWB, and John Edwards have all bested Ryan's 4:01:25 mark.

Message.Msg: Apple on Tuesday was granted a patent for a carbon fiber molding process that could one day be used to produce parts made from the lightweight material, like laptop casings or mobile device chassis. Topic.Title: Where in the heck is that stem guy?

Message.Msg: Go to LifeTech Capital for the full report dated 9-4-2012 Here is an excerpt: Data Shows Improvements in Severe Thoracic Spinal Cord Injury Patients CIRM Awards $20M to StemCells Inc. for Cervical Spinal Cord Injuries HuCNS-SC® Preclinical Data in Alzheimer’s Restores Memory Function HuCNS-SC® Phase I PMD Data in Children Shows Unprecedented Results Download Full 9-Page Note with Important Disclosures: Morning Note 09-04-12 STEM Conference Call This Morning StemCells Inc. will host a live conference call and webcast today at 11:30am Eastern Time (8:30am Pacific Time) to discuss the summary of the 6-month interim thoracic spinal cord data. Investors can listen to the conference call at 6-Month Data for Chronic Thoracic Spinal Cord Injury StemCells Inc. announced interim 6-month data from the 1st patient cohort in the Phase I/II clinical trial of their HuCNS-SC® (purified human neural stem cells) for thoracic chronic spinal cord injury. 2 out of the 3 patients showed considerable gains in sensory function and the third patient remains stable. The trial represents the first time that neural stem cells have been transplanted as a potential therapeutic agent for spinal cord injury. The data was presented by Armin Curt, M.D., Professor and Chairman of the Spinal Cord Injury Center at Balgrist University Hospital, University of Zurich and principal investigator for the clinical trial, at the 51st Annual Scientific Meeting of the International Spinal Cord Society in London. Dr. Curt stated “The gains in sensation have evolved in a progressive pattern below the level of injury and are unanticipated in spinal cord injury patients with this severity of injury, suggesting that the neural stem cells are having a beneficial clinical effect. Sensory function of all these patients was stable before transplantation, so the reappearance of sensation is rather unexpected.” It is believed that this is the first time a significant sensory improvement has been reported in patients with complete spinal cord injury following stem cell transplantation. ü The first cohort consisted of 3 patients classified as AIS-A having complete injury to the thoracic (chest-level) spinal cord. These patients have what is considered to be a “complete” injury, or no movement or feeling below the level of the injury. ü All 3 patients were transplanted 4 to 9 months after injury with a dose of 20 million cells at the site of injury. ü The surgery, immunosuppression and the cell transplants have been well tolerated by all the patients. ü There were no abnormal clinical, electrophysiological or radiological responses to the cells, and all the patients were neurologically stable through the first 6 months following transplantation. ü Changes in sensitivity to touch, heat and electrical stimuli were observed in well-defined and consistent areas below the level of injury in 2 of the patients, while no changes were observed in the third patient. ü Importantly, tests of perception of different sensory stimuli as well as measures of electrical impulse transmission across the site of injury correlate with the clinical examination, providing independent and objective confirmation of the changes in sensory function. Update on Chronic Cervical Spinal Cord Injury: Investors should note that on July 26, 2012 the California Institute of Regenerative Medicine (CIRM) awarded $20M to StemCells Inc. for the development of their HuCNS-SC® in chronic cervical spinal cord injury. Specifically, the CIRM’s Disease Team Therapy Development Award program (RFA 10-05) for up to $20M in funding for preclinical development of HuCNS-SC® (purified human neural stem cells) for cervical (neck) spinal cord injury with the goal of filing an investigational new drug (IND) application for human clinical trials within 4 years. We believe the new cervical spinal cord preclinical research program builds upon StemCell Inc.’s existing thoracic spinal cord program currently in human clinical trials.

Message.Msg: WRONG --- I back up what I say with FACTS... Let me give you an example.... Currently, a LIAR is speaking -- the Governor of Mass. said Romney FAILED while he was Governor. ROMNEY BALANCED THE BUDGET IN MASSACHUSETTS. What has this liberal fruitloop done??? LOOK at ROMNEY's SUCCESSFUL RECORD: Governor Romney's work at Bain Capital was about fixing companies that were broken and giving new companies a shot at success. Building Businesses, Creating Jobs Governor Romney's time at Bain Capital was spent fixing struggling businesses and giving new businesses a shot at success. From 1984, when Romney co-founded the firm, to February 1999 when he left to lead the Olympics, Romney helped save thousands of jobs at companies that were in trouble. And the businesses Romney helped start while at Bain Capital employ more than 100,000 people today. Since Bain Capital's founding, the company has had a remarkable record of success, especially considering that it largely invests with struggling or startup enterprises. Eighty percent of Bain Capital's portfolio companies have increased revenues, and only five percent of the companies under its control have filed for bankruptcy. Romney's work not only helped to save and create jobs, it also provided returns to investors, the majority of which were pension funds for retirees, university endowments helping with financial aid, and charities serving their local communities. This experience helped Romney fix a scandal-plagued and debt-ridden Olympics in 2002 and to fix a budget shortfall in Massachusetts. He knows how to provide strong leadership in challenging times, and he will bring that experience with him to the White House to fix America's broken economy and to create jobs for the millions of Americans who are out of work. The Obama campaign's attacks on business and free enterprise aren't just false; they explain why we aren't creating jobs. They reveal what this President really thinks about free enterprise. This is the most anti-business President in memory, and the results are clear: 23 million Americans are struggling for work, and unemployment has been above eight percent for 42 straight months. It's time to make a change to someone who understands the private sector and can get America working again.
